greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of terms in A324315 (squarefree integers m > 1 such that if prime p divides m, then the sum of the base p digits of m is at least p) less than 10^n.
link: Bernd C. Kellner and Jonathan Sondow, Power-Sum Denominators, Amer. Math. Monthly, 124 (2017), 695-709. doi:10.4169/amer.math.monthly.124.8.695, arXiv:1705.03857
Bernd C. Kellner and Jonathan Sondow, On Carmichael and polygonal numbers, Bernoulli polynomials, and sums of base-p digits, arXiv:1902.10672 [math.NT] 2019.
example: There are two terms of A324315 less than 10^3, namely, 231 and 561, so a(3) = 2.
results.author: _Bernd C. Kellner_ and _Jonathan Sondow_, Feb 23 2019
